If tourists have received their final vaccination dose 14 days before arriving in Nepal, travelers can obtain a visa on arrival (which has stopped since March 2020) and wonât have to quarantine upon arrival.     However, partially vaccinated and unvaccinated travelers will have to obtain special visas from Nepalese embassies in their home countries. Plus, they will still have to undergo a 10-day quarantine in a government-approved hotel in Kathmandu. Theyâll also need a PCR test before they go out and explore after undergoing the mandatory quarantine.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210927222521/https://www.traveloffpath.com/nepal-reopens-to-fully-vaccinated-travelers-without-restrictions/

All unvaccinated and semi-vaccinated travelers must comply with the Government of Nepalâs 10-day quarantine mandate, which requires quarantine at a local hotel at their own cost. A PCR test must be completed and returned negative on 11th day before travelling within the country will be permitted. The government of Nepal has approved exceptions for diplomatic and international organization personnel, and family members of these groups.  No vaccination or testing is required for minors below 5 years old.
